content: Great analysis Abhishek! Though, i’m finding it difficult to understand how is Zomato v/s Swiggy story in conflict with Aggregation Theory. Zomato couldn’t control distrubution/delivery and thus ended up providing a sub-par user experience in comparison to Swiggy on the most important metric that mattered to customers: Time to delivery. Thus, Swiggy aggregated customers and suppliers around the choke point of food delivery business, whereas Zomato aggregated customers and suppliers around just the discovery of interesting restaurants.
